page.title: 12Moreton Hall
page.content: The present owner has lived on the farm for 17 years.There are 23 fields altogether, 4 fields of winter wheat,3 fields of winter barley,11 fields of silage grass and 5 fields of grazing grass.Winter wheat is grown for seed, winter barley is grown to feed the animals,silage grass is for the winter feed and grazing grass is for the summer grazing. The farm owns two fields down Smythemoor lane and they grow silage grass.The fields are boggy because they have peat in.They have 230 cows,4 sheep,50 calves, 50 bull beef,150 heifers,1 donkey and 2 Hereford bulls.They use fertilsers, insecticides and fungicides.They do not use an irrigation system.There are five people working at Moreton Hall Farm including the owner.At the moment they are doing the second cut of silage grass.
